text: Thomas E. Kluczynski (September 29, 1903 - May 16, 1994) was an American jurist. Born in Chicago, Illinois, Kluczynski received his J.D. degree from the University of Chicago Law School in 1927. He then practices law until 1945 when he was appointed a commissioner of the Illinois Industrial Commission. In 1950, Governor Adlai Stevenson appointed Klucyznski to circuit court. In 1962, Kluczynski was appointed to the Illinois Appellate Court. From 1966 to 1976 and from 1978 to 1980, Kluczynski served on the Illinois Supreme Court. Kluczynski died in Chicago, Illinois.Illinois Supreme Court-Thomas E. Kluczynski'Veteran Justice Thomas E. Kluczynski,' Chicago Tribune, Kenan Heise, May 18, 1994 ==Notes== Category:1903 births Category:1994 deaths Category:Lawyers from Chicago Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:University of Chicago Law School alumni Category:Illinois state court judges Category:Judges of the Illinois Appellate Court Category:Justices of the Illinois Supreme Court Category:20th-century American judges
title: Thomas E. Kluczynski
